title: Lis Neris 2015 Picol Sauvignon (Isonzo del Friuli)
description: Grapefruit, exotic fruit and tomato vine scents lead the nose of this wine while its linear, medium-bodied palate shows honeydew melon and succulent citrus notes. Fresh acidity gives it a clean, bright finish.

title: Mercer 2014 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Pleasing aromas of herb, cherry, vanilla, and cocoa are followed by soft subtle cherry flavors. Lightly grainy tannins provide support. It doesn't seem entirely varietal but still provides enjoyment.

title: Mirabeau 2016 Pure Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A deliciously ripe and soft wine, this is also fruity and with a fine tang of clementine. There is a refreshing side to the red-currant fruitiness and intense acidity. It is lightly perfumed and finished with a touch of pepper. Drink now.

title: Lamoreaux Landing 2015 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: This Riesling's bold blossomy perfume accents honey and apple flavors on the palate. It's not deeply concentrated but its delicate sweetness and fresh cutting acidity are invigorating.

title: Underground Wine Project 2016 And Why am I Mr. Pink? Rosé of Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A very appealing pale peach color, this wine brings aromas of strawberry and cherry. The flavors are tart and decisive, with a lingering finish.
designation: And Why am I Mr. Pink? Rosé of

title: Unger 2016 Q Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: Lovely green notes of lime zest and greengage rise from the glass in this wine. The palate is light, juicy and fresh, with a dry and zingy finish. Ready for a summer party.

title: Unger 2016 Zweigelt Rosé (Niederösterreich)
description: Light bodied and fruit-driven, this wine leads with refreshing, easy citrus notes and friendly red apple nuances. It finishes dry.

title: Ronco dei Tassi 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Ripe orchard fruit and pressed yellow flower aromas lead the nose while the medium-bodied palate offers yellow apple and pear flavors. A hint of orange zest lends a tangy finish.

title: Rusack 2014 Santa Catalina Island Vineyards Zinfandel (California)
description: Old Zinfandel plant material from Santa Cruz was propagated in one of the most inhospitable sites for grapes on Catalina Island to make this wine—a fascinating story for any history lover. The wine itself is somewhat simple, with generic red fruit, turned loam and black pepper scents, followed by cranberry, white pepper and crushed rock flavors on the palate.

title: Testarossa 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Sagebrush and faint anise hints decorate the red cherry and ripe raspberry fruit in this appellation blend. The palate is lively if fairly simple, with fresh red berry flavors and a touch of garrigue.

title: Vignobles Brumont 1996 Château Montus XL Tannat (Madiran)
description: It is rare to find a wine this old as a new release. In fact, it probably should have been released a few years ago. Because its browning color, old tannins and acidity all suggest a wine that has gone past its peak. As a curiosity this is definitely right there and, for that, drink it now. Two bottles tasted.

title: Vadiaperti 2015 Aipierti  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: This has a rather subdued nose, while the palate offers citrus, pear and chopped herb notes. It's elegant and linear but a bit lean, with an energizing mineral finish.

title: Stoneburn 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Tight and linear on the palate, this is evolving very well for a $12 wine. Struck flint is prominent on the nose, adding a touch of Old World character, while the flavors feature cut grass and citrus. It's light bodied, but remarkably intense on the finish. Drink now.

title: Summers 2013 Villa Andriana Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: Smooth and round, this wine offers rich cherry cordial and milk chocolate flavors—a simple, straightforward layering of ripeness within a medium-bodied frame.

title: Tamarack Cellars 2014 Spicebox Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Grenache (52%) takes the lead on this wine followed by Mourvèdre (31%) and Counoise. Light in color, it displays aromas of strawberry, coriander, herb and baking spice. The palate brings plentiful cranberry flavors that possess a lightly creamy feel.

title: Tangent 2014 Paragon Vineyard Viognier (Edna Valley)
description: This region is known for producing lean whites from grapes that tend to be blousy in warmer zones, and this bottling is no exception. It shows crushed chalk, pomelo and gardenia aromas on the nose and is tense on the palate, its grippy white rock flavors accented with Granny Smith apple notes.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2013 Madonne Estate G-S-M (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Floral scents strike the nose with ferocity in this blend of 70% Grenache, 12% Syrah, 8% Mourvèdre, 6% Carignane and 4% Counoise, meeting richer aromas of blackberry, candied grape and asphalt. Concord grape flavors carry into the palate, with candied violet and a light bit of sweet tobacco.

title: Schiopetto 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Tropical fruit, aromatic herb and tomato vine scents jump out of the glass. The palate is focused, albeit a bit lean, offering green melon and white grapefruit flavors, with crisp acidity.

title: Schwarzböck 2016 Gelber Muskateller (Niederösterreich)
description: A touch of flint accents this wine's blossom and citrus scents. The palate is light and dry, carrying its lifted aromatics with citrusy freshness and ease.

title: Wilson 2014 Treborce Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Soft and perceptively sweet, this densely built, full-bodied and intensely ripe wine layers brown sugar and baked plum notes, with a lingering taste of cola.

title: Zenato 2016 San Benedetto  (Lugana)
description: This creamy, fresh wine opens with orchard fruit, citrus and banana scents. The medium-bodied palate delivers white peach and nectarine flavors, with bright acidity that leaves a tangy finish.

title: Timothy Moore 2015 Doyle Family Vineyards Reserve Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Crushed stone and fresh lemon persist from nose to finish on this revitalizing off-dry Riesling. It's brisk and thirst quenching, offering loads of crisp-tart peach and tangerine flavors. The finish is long and refreshingly citrusy.

title: Toi Toi 2014 Clutha Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: Not terribly tannic or concentrated, this is nevertheless a charming, savory wine for near-term consumption. Red-skinned plums marry with grilled meat and toasty oak and glide to a soft, easygoing finish. Drink now–2020.

title: Torres 2013 Celeste Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty herbal aromas of olive, asphalt and compost announce a cool-vintage wine. This feels raw and massively tannic. Roasted barely ripe plum and berry flavors finish bone dry and pulling.

title: Trust 2013 A Stone's Throw Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The cherry cola, herb, menthol and barrel-spice aromas seem a bit more evolved than their age might indicate. The palate is on the lighter side of medium bodied, with plump tannins providing support.

title: Browne Family Vineyards 2015 Heritage Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of black currant, licorice, plum and dried herb are followed by elegant flavors. The tannins show a touch of dryness.

title: Carol Shelton 2015 Coquille Blanc White (Paso Robles)
description: Dried apple, pear and fresh honeysuckle scents show on the floral and fruity nose of this blend of Grenache Blanc, Roussanne, Marsanne and Viognier. The palate overflows with fruit, from pineapple guava to banana and cherimoya, while lemony acidity holds it all together.

title: Brander 2015 Merlot (Los Olivos District)
description: Though not treating the grape with quite the same reverence as other varieties, Central Coast vintners are having fun with Merlot, making quaffable, easygoing bottlings like this one. It shows caramelized blueberry, black currant and asphalt touches on the nose. The graphite minerality also pops on the palate, giving a tension to the cassis flavors.

title: Château Minuty 2016 M de Minuty Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The wine is soft and gently fruity. With wild strawberry flavors and balanced acidity, this is a wine that floats easily. The aftertaste is lightly perfumed, with herbal hints. Drink now.

title: Château Peyros 2013 Tannat-Cabernet (Madiran)
description: This wine comes from the Madiran vineyard of the Lesgourgues family, who are also producers of Armagnac and Bordeaux. It is just beginning to mature, with the rich tannins integrating with the powerful structure and intense black-plum and currant fruits. The dry edge gives the wine concentration, while the finish brings out black-currant acidity. Drink this fine wine from 2018.
